issue.title: Should not crash when trying to load unsupported mesh files

content.raw:
confirms that this is still a problem in gazebo 7.7

backtrace:

~~~
[Err] [MeshManager.cc:102] Invalid mesh filename extension[/home/osrf/.gazebo/models/jersey_barrier/meshes/jersey_barrier.dd]
[Err] [Visual.cc:2058] Unable to create a mesh from /home/osrf/.gazebo/models/jersey_barrier/meshes/jersey_barrier.dd
[Err] [Visual.cc:362] Ogre Error:OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource /home/osrf/.gazebo/models/jersey_barrier/meshes/jersey_barrier.dd in resource group Autodetect or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /build/ogre-1.9-mqY1wq/ogre-1.9-1.9.0+dfsg1/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
[Err] [Visual.cc:363] Unable to create a mesh from /home/osrf/.gazebo/models/jersey_barrier/meshes/jersey_barrier.dd
[Err] [MeshManager.cc:102] Invalid mesh filename extension[/home/osrf/.gazebo/models/jersey_barrier/meshes/jersey_barrier.dd]
[Err] [Visual.cc:2058] Unable to create a mesh from /home/osrf/.gazebo/models/jersey_barrier/meshes/jersey_barrier.dd
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.
~~~

confirms that this is still a problem in gazebo 7.7

backtrace:

[Err] [MeshManager.cc:102] Invalid mesh filename extension[/home/osrf/.gazebo/models/jersey_barrier/meshes/jersey_barrier.dd]
